mods.abstract: Loose Photographs 17 of the album includes two photographs.; Photograph 1 shows an A-frame barn with four men, a large stack of grains, and a Steam Tractor and Threshing Machine.; Photograph 2 shows a man in overalls with a pitchfork standing in a field of grains stacked for drying, probable lespedeza. In the background two men load hay onto a horse drawn wagon with farm buildings shown in the distance.
mods.note: Compare Photograph 1 to the following publication. Dodson, W.R. (1911, September) Lespedeza or Japan Clover. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 130, p. 56. Photograph is captioned, "Thrushing lespedeza seed. Yield nearly seven bushels per acre." Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=de42AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA5-PA1&lpg=RA5-PA1&dq=Louisiana+Bulletin+No.+130+1911+Dodson&source=bl&ots=2rOHUxPJUa&sig=n32VJFq6oJR99Jyfmtrvi46E-hY&hl=en&sa=X&ei=ZyrEU7D0AeXo8QGdj4DQDg&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Sherwood&f=false; Compare Photograph 2 to the following publication. Dodson, W.R. (1911, September) Lespedeza or Japan Clover. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 130, p. 41. Photograph is captioned, "A Paying Crop of Lespedeza on the Farm of Col. J.B. McGehee, Laurel Hill, LA." Same as link listed above.
